answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some reports and policies regarding the removal of traffic signals which you may find useful. 
This document is from the Alabama Department of Transportation and you can read more about signal removal on page 19.
http://www.dot.state.al.us/dsweb/Traffic/pdf/AldotTrafficSignalManual122007.pdf
Section 6.3 of this report on Transportation Systems from The Rogue Valley Council of Governments is also about when to remove traffic lights.
http://www.rvcog.org/pdf/Planning_RTP_Section_6.pdf
I have included a similar report from the Texas Transportation Institute where you can find more information  about removal on page 8.
http://tti.tamu.edu/documents/0-4701-P2.pdf
Page 27 of the Oregon Department of Transportation Traffic Signal Policy and Guidelines covers removal processes and procedures.
http://www.oregon.gov/ODOT/HWY/TRAFFIC-ROADWAY/docs/pdf/Traffic_Signal_Policy_and_Guidelines.pdf?ga=t
This report is on Traffic Calming through Traffic Signal Removal from the City of Leslie, MI.
http://www.ite.org/traffic/documents/AB01H0302.pdf
This sample policy from Maryland discusses general guidelines for traffic lights.
http://sha.md.gov/MMUTCD/4b.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
